00055 /**
00056  * Represents a single request/response pair of an application process.
00057  *
00058  * Session is used to forward a single HTTP request to an application
00059  * process, and to read back the HTTP response. A Session object is to
00060  * be used in the following manner:
00061  *
00062  *  -# Serialize the HTTP request headers into a format as expected by
00063  *     sendHeaders(), then send that string by calling sendHeaders().
00064  *  -# In case of a POST of PUT request, send the HTTP request body by
00065  *     calling sendBodyBlock(), possibly multiple times.
00066  *  -# Shutdown the writer end of the session channel (shutdownWriter())
00067  *     since you're now done sending data.
00068  *  -# The HTTP response can now be read through the session channel (getStream()).
00069  *  -# When the HTTP response has been read, the session must be closed.
00070  *     This is done by destroying the Session object.
00071  *
00072  * A usage example is shown in Process::newSession().
00073  *
00074  * Session is an abstract base class. Concrete implementations can be found in
00075  * StandardSession and ApplicationPool::Client::RemoteSession.
00076  *
00077  * Session is not guaranteed to be thread-safe.
00078  */
00079 class Session {
00080 protected:
00081         string detachKey;
00082         string connectPassword;
00083         string gupid;
00084         
00085 public:
00086         /**
00087          * Concrete classes might throw arbitrary exceptions.
00088          */
00089         virtual ~Session() {}
00090         
00091         /**
00092          * Initiate the session by connecting to the associated process.
00093          * A Session is not usable until it's initiated.
00094          *
00095          * @throws SystemException Something went wrong.
00096          * @throws IOException Something went wrong.
00097          * @throws boost::thread_interrupted
00098          */
00099         virtual void initiate() = 0;
00100         
00101         /**
00102          * Returns whether this session has been initiated (that is, whether
00103          * initiate() had been called in the past).
00104          */
00105         virtual bool initiated() const = 0;
00106         
00107         /**
00108          * Returns the type of the socket that this session is served from,
00109          * e.g. "unix" indicating a Unix socket.
00110          *
00111          * @post !result.empty()
00112          */
00113         virtual string getSocketType() const = 0;
00114         
00115         /**
00116          * Returns the address of the socket that this session is served
00117          * from. This can be a Unix socket filename or a TCP host:port string
00118          * like "127.0.0.1:1234".
00119          *
00120          * @post !result.empty()
00121          */
00122         virtual string getSocketName() const = 0;
00123         
00124         /**
00125          * Send HTTP request headers to the application. The HTTP headers must be
00126          * converted into CGI headers, and then encoded into a string that matches this grammar:
00127          *
00128            @verbatim
00129            headers ::= header*
00130            header ::= name NUL value NUL
00131            name ::= notnull+
00132            value ::= notnull+
00133            notnull ::= "\x01" | "\x02" | "\x02" | ... | "\xFF"
00134            NUL = "\x00"
00135            @endverbatim
00136          *
00137          * There must be a header with the name "PASSWORD_CONNECT_PASSWORD", and it must
00138          * have the same value as the string returned by getConnectPassword().
00139          *
00140          * This method should be the first one to be called during the lifetime of a Session
00141          * object, otherwise strange things may happen.
00142          *
00143          * @param headers The HTTP request headers, converted into CGI headers and encoded as
00144          *                a string, according to the description.
00145          * @param size The size, in bytes, of <tt>headers</tt>.
00146          * @pre headers != NULL
00147          * @pre initiated()
00148          * @throws IOException The I/O channel has already been closed or discarded.
00149          * @throws SystemException Something went wrong during writing.
00150          * @throws boost::thread_interrupted
00151          */
00152         virtual void sendHeaders(const char *headers, unsigned int size) {
00153                 TRACE_POINT();
00154                 int stream = getStream();
00155                 if (stream == -1) {
00156                         throw IOException("Cannot write headers to the request handler "
00157                                 "because the I/O stream has already been closed or discarded.");
00158                 }
00159                 try {
00160                         MessageChannel(stream).writeScalar(headers, size);
00161                 } catch (SystemException &e) {
00162                         e.setBriefMessage("An error occured while writing headers "
00163                                 "to the request handler");
00164                         throw;
00165                 }
00166         }
00167         
00168         /**
00169          * Convenience shortcut for sendHeaders(const char *, unsigned int)
00170          * @param headers The headers
00171          * @pre initiated()
00172          * @throws IOException The I/O channel has already been closed or discarded.
00173          * @throws SystemException Something went wrong during writing.
00174          * @throws boost::thread_interrupted
00175          */
00176         virtual void sendHeaders(const StaticString &headers) {
00177                 sendHeaders(headers.c_str(), headers.size());
00178         }
00179         
00180         /**
00181          * Send a chunk of HTTP request body data to the application.
00182          * You can call this method as many times as is required to transfer
00183          * the entire HTTP request body.
00184          *
00185          * This method must only be called after a sendHeaders(), otherwise
00186          * strange things may happen.
00187          *
00188          * @param block A block of HTTP request body data to send.
00189          * @param size The size, in bytes, of <tt>block</tt>.
00190          * @pre initiated()
00191          * @throws IOException The I/O channel has already been closed or discarded.
00192          * @throws SystemException Something went wrong during writing.
00193          * @throws boost::thread_interrupted
00194          */
00195         virtual void sendBodyBlock(const char *block, unsigned int size) {
00196                 TRACE_POINT();
00197                 int stream = getStream();
00198                 if (stream == -1) {
00199                         throw IOException("Cannot write request body block to the "
00200                                 "request handler because the I/O channel has "
00201                                 "already been closed or discarded.");
00202                 }
00203                 try {
00204                         MessageChannel(stream).writeRaw(block, size);
00205                 } catch (SystemException &e) {
00206                         e.setBriefMessage("An error occured while sending the "
00207                                 "request body to the request handler");
00208                         throw;
00209                 }
00210         }
00211         
00212         /**
00213          * Returns this session's channel's file descriptor. This stream is
00214          * full-duplex, and will be automatically closed upon Session's
00215          * destruction, unless discardStream() is called.
00216          *
00217          * @pre initiated()
00218          * @returns The file descriptor, or -1 if the I/O channel has already
00219          *          been closed or discarded.
00220          */
00221         virtual int getStream() const = 0;
00222         
00223         /**
00224          * Set the timeout value for reading data from the I/O channel.
00225          * If no data can be read within the timeout period, then the
00226          * read call will fail with error EAGAIN or EWOULDBLOCK.
00227          *
00228          * @pre The I/O channel hasn't been closed or discarded.
00229          * @pre initiated()
00230          * @param msec The timeout, in milliseconds. If 0 is given,
00231          *             there will be no timeout.
00232          * @throws SystemException Cannot set the timeout.
00233          */
00234         virtual void setReaderTimeout(unsigned int msec) = 0;
00235         
00236         /**
00237          * Set the timeout value for writing data from the I/O channel.
00238          * If no data can be written within the timeout period, then the
00239          * write call will fail with error EAGAIN or EWOULDBLOCK.
00240          *
00241          * @pre The I/O channel hasn't been closed or discarded.
00242          * @pre initiated()
00243          * @param msec The timeout, in milliseconds. If 0 is given,
00244          *             there will be no timeout.
00245          * @throws SystemException Cannot set the timeout.
00246          */
00247         virtual void setWriterTimeout(unsigned int msec) = 0;
00248         
00249         /**
00250          * Indicate that we don't want to read data anymore from the I/O channel.
00251          * Calling this method after closeStream()/discardStream() is called will
00252          * have no effect.
00253          *
00254          * @pre initiated()
00255          * @throws SystemException Something went wrong.
00256          * @throws boost::thread_interrupted
00257          */
00258         virtual void shutdownReader() = 0;
00259         
00260         /**
00261          * Indicate that we don't want to write data anymore to the I/O channel.
00262          * Calling this method after closeStream()/discardStream() is called will
00263          * have no effect.
00264          *
00265          * @pre initiated()
00266          * @throws SystemException Something went wrong.
00267          * @throws boost::thread_interrupted
00268          */
00269         virtual void shutdownWriter() = 0;
00270         
00271         /**
00272          * Close the I/O stream.
00273          *
00274          * @throws SystemException Something went wrong.
00275          * @throws boost::thread_interrupted
00276          * @pre initiated()
00277          * @post getStream() == -1
00278          */
00279         virtual void closeStream() = 0;
00280         
00281         /**
00282          * Discard the I/O channel's file descriptor, so that the destructor
00283          * won't automatically close it.
00284          *
00285          * @pre initiated()
00286          * @post getStream() == -1
00287          */
00288         virtual void discardStream() = 0;
00289         
00290         /**
00291          * Get the process ID of the application process that this session
00292          * belongs to.
00293          */
00294         virtual pid_t getPid() const = 0;

00297                 return detachKey;
00298         }

00300         /**
00301          * Returns this session's process's connect password. This password is

00303          */
00304         const string getConnectPassword() const {
00305                 return connectPassword;

00310         }

00316 /**
00317  * A "standard" implementation of Session.
00318  */
00319 class StandardSession: public Session {
00320 public:
00321         typedef function<void (const StandardSession *)> CloseCallback;
00322         
00323 protected:
00324         pid_t pid;
00325         CloseCallback closeCallback;
00326         string socketType;
00327         string socketName;
00328         
00329         /** The session connection file descriptor. */
00330         int fd;
00331         bool isInitiated;
00332         
00333 public:
00334         StandardSession(pid_t pid,
00335                         const CloseCallback &closeCallback,
00336                         const string &socketType,
00337                         const string &socketName,
00338                         const string &detachKey,
00339                         const string &connectPassword,
00340                         const string &gupid)
00341         {
00342                 TRACE_POINT();
00343                 if (socketType != "unix" && socketType != "tcp") {
00344                         throw IOException("Unsupported socket type '" + socketType + "'");
00345                 }
00346                 this->pid = pid;
00347                 this->closeCallback = closeCallback;
00348                 this->socketType    = socketType;
00349                 this->socketName    = socketName;
00350                 this->detachKey     = detachKey;
00351                 this->connectPassword = connectPassword;
00352                 this->gupid         = gupid;
00353                 fd = -1;
00354                 isInitiated = false;
00355         }
00356         
00357         virtual ~StandardSession() {
00358                 TRACE_POINT();
00359                 closeStream();
00360                 if (closeCallback != NULL) {
00361                         closeCallback(this);
00362                 }
00363         }
00364         
00365         virtual void initiate() {
00366                 TRACE_POINT();
00367                 if (socketType == "unix") {
00368                         fd = connectToUnixServer(socketName.c_str());
00369                 } else {
00370                         vector<string> args;
00371                         
00372                         split(socketName, ':', args);
00373                         if (args.size() != 2 || atoi(args[1]) == 0) {
00374                                 UPDATE_TRACE_POINT();
00375                                 throw IOException("Invalid TCP/IP address '" + socketName + "'");
00376                         }
00377                         fd = connectToTcpServer(args[0].c_str(), atoi(args[1]));
00378                 }
00379                 isInitiated = true;
00380         }
00381         
00382         virtual bool initiated() const {
00383                 return isInitiated;
00384         }
00385         
00386         virtual string getSocketType() const {
00387                 return socketType;
00388         }
00389         
00390         virtual string getSocketName() const {
00391                 return socketName;
00392         }
00393         
00394         virtual int getStream() const {
00395                 return fd;
00396         }
00397         
00398         virtual void setReaderTimeout(unsigned int msec) {
00399                 MessageChannel(fd).setReadTimeout(msec);
00400         }
00401         
00402         virtual void setWriterTimeout(unsigned int msec) {
00403                 MessageChannel(fd).setWriteTimeout(msec);
00404         }
00405         
00406         virtual void shutdownReader() {
00407                 TRACE_POINT();
00408                 if (fd != -1) {
00409                         int ret = syscalls::shutdown(fd, SHUT_RD);
00410                         if (ret == -1) {
00411                                 int e = errno;
00412                                 // ENOTCONN is harmless here.
00413                                 if (e != ENOTCONN) {
00414                                         throw SystemException("Cannot shutdown the reader stream",
00415                                                 e);
00416                                 }
00417                         }
00418                 }
00419         }
00420         
00421         virtual void shutdownWriter() {
00422                 TRACE_POINT();
00423                 if (fd != -1) {
00424                         int ret = syscalls::shutdown(fd, SHUT_WR);
00425                         if (ret == -1) {
00426                                 int e = errno;
00427                                 // ENOTCONN is harmless here.
00428                                 if (e != ENOTCONN) {
00429                                         throw SystemException("Cannot shutdown the writer stream",
00430                                                 e);
00431                                 }
00432                         }
00433                 }
00434         }
00435         
00436         virtual void closeStream() {
00437                 TRACE_POINT();
00438                 if (fd != -1) {
00439                         int ret = syscalls::close(fd);
00440                         fd = -1;
00441                         if (ret == -1) {
00442                                 int e = errno;
00443                                 if (errno == EIO) {
00444                                         throw SystemException(
00445                                                 "A write operation on the session stream failed",
00446                                                 e);
00447                                 } else {
00448                                         throw SystemException(
00449                                                 "Cannot close the session stream",
00450                                                 e);
00451                                 }
00452                         }
00453                 }
00454         }
00455         
00456         virtual void discardStream() {
00457                 fd = -1;
00458         }
00459         
00460         virtual pid_t getPid() const {
00461                 return pid;
00462         }
00463 };
